messages.content:
Here are the hotels with rooms that can still be booked tonight (check-in 25 Nov 2024, check-out 26 Nov 2024) within about 100 km of your coordinates (40.9042 N, 106.4074 E).  Only one property still shows availability.

────────────────────────────────────────
RAMADA BY WYNDHAM BAYANNUR  ★★★★
40 km SE of your position – 40.7603 N, 107.4048 E
Review score 10 / 10 (1 review)

All rooms listed below are:
 • Free cancellation until 23:59 on 23 Nov 2024  
 • No pre-payment – pay at the property  
 • No meals included  
 • Private bathroom, 30–90 m², free parking on site  
 • Prices shown are for tonight only (1 night, 1 room, 1 adult).  
Extra charges on arrival: 6 % VAT + 10 % service (already quoted separately).

1) Superior King Room – Non-Smoking  
   – 1 king bed, 30 m²  
   – CNY 298.46 (≈ US $41.94) + CNY 49.54 taxes/fees  
   – Total: CNY 348.00 (≈ US $48.91)  
   – 18 rooms left.

2) Superior Twin Room – Non-Smoking  
   – 2 single beds, 30 m²  
   – Same price & conditions as above.  
   – 9 rooms left.

3) Executive King Room – Non-Smoking  
   – 1 king bed, 32 m², higher floor, extra space  
   – CNY 349.92 (≈ US $49.18) + CNY 58.09 taxes/fees  
   – Total: CNY 408.01 (≈ US $57.34)  
   – 9 rooms left.

4) Executive Twin Room – Non-Smoking  
   – 2 single beds, 32 m²  
   – Same price & conditions as Executive King.  
   – 6 rooms left.

5) Superior King Suite – Non-Smoking  
   – 1-bedroom suite, 90 m² with living area  
   – CNY 512.87 (≈ US $72.08) + CNY 85.14 taxes/fees  
   – Total: CNY 598.01 (≈ US $84.04)  
   – Only 3 suites left.

Check-in from 14:00; check-out until 14:00.  Free on-site parking is available and can be reserved.

No other hotels inside the 100 km radius are showing availability for tonight.

Let me know if you’d like me to place a booking, filter by price, look for other dates, or need anything else!

messages.content:
Here are all of the rooms that are still book-able tonight (check-in Tue 10 Dec 2024, check-out Wed 11 Dec 2024) within ~120 km of your current position (38.9042 N, 104.4074 E).  Prices are for the whole stay (1 night, 1 room, 1 adult) and already include all taxes/fees shown by the hotels.  Currency conversions use the figures supplied by the hotel feeds (≈7.12 CNY = 1 USD at time of quote).

────────────────────────────────────
1)  Kyriad Marvelous Hotel Alashan   (3-star, “凯里亚德唯怡酒店·阿拉善店”)
   • Location: Alxa Left Banner (≈85 km ESE of you)
   • Check-in / out: 14:00–18:00 / before 12:00
   • All rooms below require NO pre-payment, NO credit-card guarantee, and allow FREE cancellation until 23:59 on 9 Dec (1 day before arrival).

   ─ Available room types ─
   a. Premier Twin Room – 32 m², 2 single beds, no breakfast  
      CNY 255  (≈ US$ 35.79)

   b. Premier Double Room – 32 m², 1 king, no breakfast  
      CNY 275  (≈ US$ 38.65)

   c. Honorable Double Room – 32 m², 1 king, no breakfast  
      CNY 302  (≈ US$ 42.44)

   d. Superior Twin Room – 32 m², 2 single beds, no breakfast  
      CNY 312  (≈ US$ 43.85)

   e. Premier Suite – 65 m², 1 bedroom suite, no breakfast  
      CNY 559  (≈ US$ 78.56) – only 2 suites left

   Key policies (all rooms): pay at the property, free cancellation until 9 Dec, no deposit, no credit-card needed.  After the deadline, the full stay is chargeable for cancellation/no-show.


────────────────────────────────────
2)  Vienna International Hotel ‑ Inner Mongolia Alxa League   (5-star, “维也纳国际酒店·阿拉善盟店”)
   • Location: Alxa League city centre (≈86 km ESE of you; same urban area as the Kyriad)
   • Check-in / out: 14:00–18:00 / before 12:00
   • All rooms listed here are NON-REFUNDABLE and require full pre-payment (the hotel will charge your card or require cash immediately).  A refundable CNY 300–600 deposit may be taken at check-in.

   ─ Available room types ─
   a. Deluxe Twin Room – 30 m², 2 single beds, no breakfast  
      CNY 293  (≈ US$ 41.18)

   b. Deluxe King Room – 15 m², 1 king bed (compact room), no breakfast  
      CNY 302  (≈ US$ 42.44)

   c. Business Twin Room – 15 m², 2 single beds, no breakfast  
      CNY 340  (≈ US$ 47.78) – only 1 room left

   d. Business Suite – 1-bedroom suite (suite size not given clearly in feed), no breakfast  
      CNY 616  (≈ US$ 86.57) – only 1 suite left

   Key policies (all rooms): non-refundable & pre-paid; if you cancel or no-show you will be charged the full amount.  Deposit required on arrival.


────────────────────────────────────
How to choose?

• Need flexibility?  Pick any room at Kyriad Marvelous – free cancellation until 23:59 on 9 Dec and no payment today.

• Best price tonight?  Kyriad’s Premier Twin (≈ US$ 36) is the lowest.

• Want a higher-end brand and don’t mind paying up-front?  Vienna International offers larger hotel facilities, but every room is strictly non-refundable.

If you’d like to book one of these rooms or need anything else (extra guests, breakfast, multiple rooms, a different date, etc.) just let me know!

messages.content:
Here’s what recent guests have been saying about Shangri-La Vancouver (overall score 8.9/10, “Fabulous”, 140 verified Booking.com reviews):

Key positives
• Location – Steps from downtown restaurants, shopping and attractions; repeatedly called “perfect” and “great for families”.  
• Service – Staff are described as “amazing”, “helpful” and “knowledgeable”. Several guests mentioned complimentary upgrades and welcome amenities.  
• Rooms & beds – Spacious, elegantly furnished, very comfortable beds; many liked the in-room technology and bathrooms.  
• Atmosphere – The lobby and public areas give “a feeling of opulence” according to multiple reviewers.  

Common negatives
• Size of some facilities – A few guests felt standard rooms, the pool, jacuzzi and elevators were on the small side for a 5-star.  
• Noise – An isolated comment about hearing a neighbour’s dog.  
• Lobby bar – One reviewer expected a more vibrant bar/lounge scene.

Representative recent reviews
1.  “Beautiful surroundings with knowledgeable staff and the most comfortable bed.” (John, UK – Feb 2024, 4/5)  
2.  “Impeccable property … upgraded to a suite so we could check in early. Complimentary wine and chocolates awaited us.” (Mary, USA – Dec 2023, 4/5)  
3.  “Well located and the staff was nice, but rooms were small and I heard the dog next door.” (Joana, USA – Feb 2024, 3.6/5)  
4.  “Beautifully appointed rooms, fabulous service, perfect location. Tight elevators, no lobby bar.” (Scott, Canada – Sep 2023, 3.2/5)  
5.  “Helpful staff and great location; pool and jacuzzi are small.” (Shane, USA – Aug 2023, 3.6/5)

Hotel management responses  
The hotel manager (Kate Martin) replies to nearly every review, thanking guests for positives and apologizing for any shortcomings—an indicator of active guest-relations.

Bottom line  
Guests overwhelmingly praise the Shangri-La Vancouver for its five-star service, luxurious rooms and prime downtown location. Criticisms center on some space constraints (pool, elevators, certain room categories) and minor noise issues. If those factors are acceptable, reviews suggest you can expect a high-end, service-focused stay during 15–20 November 2024.

messages.content:
Element Edmonton West – What recent guests are saying
(Last 6 months – reviews in English)

Overall sentiment
• Recent reviews are strongly positive, clustering around 4 / 5.
• Guests consistently praise staff friendliness and room cleanliness.
• A few recurring negatives: pool & fitness-centre closure for renovations and occasional elevator or pet odour.

Highlighted themes

1. Rooms & beds – very positive
   • “The configuration of the room with kitchenette … and the bed is the best!”  
   • Spacious studios and rooms with king or queen beds; many include a small kitchen (cook-top, fridge, dishwasher).

2. Cleanliness
   • Multiple reviews explicitly call the hotel “very clean” or “spotless.”

3. Service
   • “Staff always great … cheerful and very helpful.”
   • Front-desk and housekeeping receive frequent compliments for going “above and beyond.”

4. Extras / social hour
   • Daily “manager’s reception” or afternoon tea with cheese & wine is popular for meeting other travellers.

5. Parking
   • Guests like the secure, heated underground garage (fee applies).

6. Current drawbacks
   • Pool & gym: still closed for renovation as of mid-July 2024. Some guests felt the room price should reflect the missing facilities.
   • Elevator: a couple of comments about being warm or having a pet smell (hotel is pet-friendly).
   • Limited dining on-site (only a lobby pantry) but lots of restaurants within a 5- to 10-minute drive.

Representative excerpts

• “Always a 5-star stay. Staff always great and facilities clean.” (Oct 2024)
• “They hold afternoon tea with cheese and wine every afternoon – lovely chance to meet other guests.” (Sept 2024)
• “Would stay here just for the bed! … But elevators were stuffy and pool still closed.” (July 2024)
• “Great place to stay while visiting Edmonton. Staff is always cheerful.” (July 2024)
• “Good-sized room, very clean, staff accommodating.” (July 2024)

Tips for your 10–15 Nov 2024 stay

• Pool & gym: Confirm with the hotel whether renovations will be finished by November if those amenities matter to you.
• Room choice: Studios include a full kitchenette and sofa bed—useful for longer stays. Ask for a higher floor away from elevators if you’re sensitive to occasional pet odour.
• Social hour: Plan to be in the lobby around 5 pm for the complimentary cheese, wine & tea.
• Parking: If you’re driving, request underground parking at check-in (added fee but worth it in cold weather).
• Grocery run: There’s a Costco and a Safeway within a 5-minute drive if you want to stock the kitchenette.

Bottom line

Element Edmonton West earns high marks for modern, spacious rooms, excellent beds and standout service. As long as the temporary closure of the pool/fitness area (and minor pet-friendly smells) aren’t deal-breakers, most guests rate it an “exceptional” value in west Edmonton.

messages.content:
Here are the most recent guest reviews for Four Points by Sheraton Winnipeg South (pulled directly from the hotel’s Booking.com feed). I’ve listed the five latest English-language reviews so you can gauge what people are saying in 2024.

————————————————
1) “Very good” – Jessica (United Kingdom)  
   • Stayed: Sept 12-14 2024 – Guest Room, 1 King  
   • Score: 6.4 / 10  
   • Trip type: Leisure / Couple  
   • Liked: “Staff were on hand and willing to assist when we needed it. The environment was conducive for relaxing and the facilities were a welcome addition.”  
   • Disliked: “I paid for B&B for two days but only had breakfast on one day despite being told I would receive a packed breakfast on the second.”

2) “The staff were friendly and accommodating” – Linda (Canada)  
   • Stayed: Aug 17-23 2024 – Guest Room, 2 Queen  
   • Score: 7.2 / 10  
   • Trip type: Leisure / Family  
   • Liked: “Beautiful property; perfect location for us!”  
   • (No negative points recorded)

3) “Very good” – Sergey (Canada)  
   • Stayed: Jul 8-9 2024 – Guest Room, 1 King  
   • Score: 6.4 / 10  
   • Trip type: Leisure / Family  
   • Liked: “Good and nice to stay for a couple nights.”  
   • Disliked: “Had to pay for breakfast; at this price it should be included.”

4) “Pleasant” – Rafael (Canada)  
   • Stayed: Jun 24-25 2024 – Guest Room, 1 King  
   • Score: 5.6 / 10  
   • Trip type: Business / Family  
   • Liked: “Restaurant and friendly staff.”  
   • Disliked: “The entire floor smelled and my room was humid and smelled off.”

5) “It was very comfortable” – Karen (Canada)  
   • Stayed: Jun 6-10 2024 – Guest Room, 1 King  
   • Score: 7.2 / 10  
   • Trip type: Leisure / Couple  
   • Liked: “Location, staff.”  
   • (No negative points recorded)

————————————————
Snapshot of overall sentiment
• Average review score shown in search results: 7.6 / 10 (“Good”) from ~120 reviews.  
• Positive themes: Friendly staff, convenient south-Winnipeg location, comfortable rooms, decent on-site restaurant and leisure facilities.  
• Negative themes: Extra cost for breakfast, occasional odor/humidity issues on some floors, value-for-money concerns.

For your dates (1 Dec – 6 Dec 2024) you’ll likely see similar service levels. If breakfast cost/value is important, consider booking a rate that explicitly includes it or plan for nearby cafés. You might also ask for a room on a recently refreshed floor to avoid any lingering odor/humidity complaints.

Let me know if you’d like more detailed ratings (cleanliness, comfort, Wi-Fi, etc.) or additional, older reviews!

Thank you for taking the time to share with us your comments on your comments on your recent stay in our establishment. We are happy to read that you appreciated the friendliness and helpfulness of our employees as well as the cleanliness and comfort of our installations, and we would like to inform you that none of our suites are equipped with tables and chairs. We hope to see you again the next time you visit Quebec City!

Management
Holiday Inn Express Quebec
result.cons: Some suites seem to have tables and chairs, and others do not - it's really not clear when booking which you're getting if you go according to the pictures – I suppose having booked last minute and getting the last suite in the hotel, we got one that didn't have them, but it would have been nice to know. Had to change our dinner plans last minute on the night we arrived.
result.title: Comfortable, clean, great service
result.pros: Comfortable beds and clean rooms. Good breakfast, with some options being changed up a little every morning. Nice to have the variety! The sofa bed was actually made when we arrived, which was very much appreciated after a long drive! Super friendly and helpful staff on all fronts, and the housekeeping staff were also really considerate when cleaning and restocking the room. Helpful information brochures were everywhere in the room where some things might need explaining.
Clean, accessible and great location

messages.content:
Four Seasons Hotel Toronto at Yorkville – Snapshot from recent Booking.com guest feedback  
Overall rating: 9.1 / 10 (“Superb”) from 187 verified reviews

Recurring positives
• Five-star Four Seasons service – multiple guests single out the concierge desk for “solving every request in no time,” including restaurant bookings and car hire.  
• Newly renovated rooms – guests like the fresh décor, premium bed-linens and in-room amenities (notably the Lalique toiletries).  
• Food & beverage – the hotel bar and the on-site restaurants (d|bar and Café Boulud) are praised for both atmosphere and quality.  
• Wellness facilities – the spa, indoor pool and well-equipped gym frequently earn “🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟” comments.  
• Yorkville location – upscale neighbourhood, close to designer boutiques, ROM museum, subway.

Commonly mentioned drawbacks
• Nearby construction along Bloor Street can create street noise or obstruct views for some rooms.  
• Slightly removed from the downtown core (≈10-15 min by car); one reviewer noted it’s “a bit of a distance from downtown Toronto.”  
• Minor quibbles: limited fruit selection at breakfast, premium pricing (though several guests still felt it was “value for money”).

Sample verbatim reviews (Aug–Jul 2024)
1. “It was perfect. I’d like to personally thank the concierge team that solved all my requests in no time—from car rental to a last-minute dinner reservation on a Saturday night.” – Mercedes, Brazil (Family trip)  
2. “Everything is Four Seasons style—great! Location has a fair amount of construction happening around the hotel.” – Ahmed, UK (Couple)  
3. “Spectacular service, great new completely redecorated rooms. Amazing bar and restaurants… The best bed linen and toiletries!” – Luis, Canada (Couple)  
4. “Everything, value for money… I wanted more fruits.” – Abdul-Rasheed, USA (Family)  
5. “Great service and location. Wonderful stay; thank you for the great service.” – Xiaocheng, USA (Couple)

Bottom line
Travellers consistently rate the property for its polished service, luxurious rooms and strong food-and-beverage program. If construction activity outside or the premium room rates aren’t deal-breakers, the Four Seasons remains one of Toronto’s highest-scoring hotels—well suited to a New Year’s stay.

messages.content:
Here is what recent guests are saying about Holiday Inn Calgary Airport, an IHG Hotel (overall score on Booking.com: 7.8 / 10 from ~850 reviews)

Overall impression
• Rated “Good” – guests generally find it reliable for a short airport stay, business trip or quick stop-over.  
• Most praise centres on the helpful staff and the free airport shuttle; the biggest recurring complaint is noise from in-room HVAC units.

What guests like
• Friendly, attentive front-desk and housekeeping teams – mentioned in nearly every positive review.  
• Free, on-demand shuttle makes airport transfers easy (10-15 min).  
• Location: close to YYC and a quick drive to downtown/Trans-Canada Hwy.  
• Rooms are spacious and beds comfortable; suites with two queen beds are popular with families.  
• Good value compared with downtown properties; free parking.  
• Fast Wi-Fi; many rooms recently refreshed; good water pressure.

What guests don’t like
• Heating/AC units can be loud; a few guests were woken repeatedly by fan noise.  
• Décor in some corridors and bathrooms feels dated; isolated reports of minor maintenance issues (loose fixtures, worn carpets).  
• No complimentary breakfast on the lowest rates; on-site restaurant gets mixed feedback and closes relatively early.  
• Surrounding area is commercial/industrial, so dining and shops are a short drive rather than a walk.  
• Occasional comments about thin walls or hallway noise during busy periods.

Representative recent comments (October 2024)
• “Receptionist and the cleaning staff were very friendly and helpful.” – Moe (Family)  
• “Great location and shuttle to airport… would stay again.” – Jatinderpal (Group of friends)  
• “All good for accessibility and services.” – Richard (Couple)  
• “AC was loud even on low setting, contributed to poor night’s sleep.” – David (Business)  
• “If you turn off the heater it gets cold, but if you leave it on it’s noisy.” – Guiqiu (Solo)

Good to know for your 25–30 Nov 2024 stay
• Ask for a room away from the elevator/ice machine and request a unit with a quieter HVAC system if you’re a light sleeper.  
• Shuttle runs on a schedule—reserve a departure slot at check-in.  
• Breakfast vouchers can be added at the desk if they’re not in your rate.  
• IHG members sometimes receive complimentary upgrades or late check-out when occupancy allows.

If you need anything else—room type advice, nearby dining options, transit tips—let me know!

messages.content:
AC Hotel by Marriott Montreal Downtown (the full, official name of “Marriott Hotel Montreal”) currently has:

• Overall score: 8.5 / 10 (“Very Good”)  
• Review volume: ≈1,350 verified guest reviews on Booking.com  
• Property class: 4-star

Below is a snapshot of the most recent English-language reviews and the main themes that emerge.

──────────────────────────────────
Recent verified reviews (Oct 2024)
──────────────────────────────────
1. “Exceptional” – Paula, USA, Family stay, 10 Oct 2024  
   PROS: “Great location and price, clean place and friendly staff. We loved to stay in this hotel.”  
   CONS: None mentioned  
   RATING: 10/10

2. “Fabulous” – James, New Zealand, Family w/ children, 13 Oct 2024  
   PROS: Spacious room, very comfortable beds, long lap-friendly pool & jacuzzi, sauna, helpful staff, convenient underground parking.  
   CONS: Costly parking fee, sliding glass bathroom door “lets odour & sounds travel,” no tea bags—only coffee.  
   RATING: 9/10

3. “Convenient spot for pretty much everything” – Jonah-Paul, Canada, Group of friends, 9 Oct 2024  
   PROS: City views, lots of natural light, spacious bathroom, central location.  
   CONS: “Nothing.”  
   RATING: 9/10

4. “Great location, comfortable and clean room” – Michael, USA, Couple, 5 Oct 2024  
   PROS: Central location, nicely appointed room, cleanliness.  
   CONS: Restaurant/bar appears understaffed.  
   RATING: 8/10

5. “Pleasant” – Yvonne, New Zealand, Solo traveller, 2 Oct 2024  
   PROS: “Location was great.”  
   CONS: Room felt cold.  
   RATING: 7/10

──────────────────────────────────
What guests like most
──────────────────────────────────
• Location: Steps from downtown attractions, restaurants, and the Metro.  
• Room comfort: Modern, spacious layouts; very comfortable beds; good soundproofing.  
• Facilities: Rooftop-style indoor pool long enough for laps, large hot tub, sauna, and well-equipped fitness room.  
• Cleanliness & upkeep: Consistently praised as spotless and well maintained.  
• Staff: Friendly, professional front-desk team; responsive to requests.

──────────────────────────────────
Where guests see room for improvement
──────────────────────────────────
• Parking cost: Underground parking is convenient but many find it expensive.  
• Bathroom privacy: Sliding frosted-glass doors aren’t ideal for families or friends sharing.  
• Food & beverage: Bar/restaurant service can feel understaffed at busy times, and in-room hot-drink options are coffee-only (tea drinkers take note).  
• HVAC quirks: A few comments about rooms running cool.

──────────────────────────────────
Bottom line
──────────────────────────────────
Travellers rate the AC Hotel by Marriott Montreal Downtown very highly for its location, contemporary design, cleanliness, and leisure facilities. Minor drawbacks include parking fees and the modern (some say too-open) bathroom design, plus occasional service delays at the on-site bar/restaurant. Overall it’s a strong 4-star option for a December 10–15 stay.

messages.content:
Here’s what guest feedback says about every property that meets your dates (10–20 Nov 2024), price band (US $200–300 total for the 10-night stay) and 20 km radius of Tokyo Tower.

────────────────────────
1. Hotel Plus Hostel TOKYO KAWASAKI  
• Location: 35 min by JR train from Kawasaki Station to Tokyo Tower area; 5 min walk from Kawasaki Station.  
• Price for 10 nights (sample dorm bed): ≈ US $225, incl. taxes.  
• Overall rating: 7.6 / 10 (“Good”) from ≈ 710 reviews.

What guests like  
– Clean rooms, bathrooms and common areas.  
– Secure (key-card entry, female-only floors, lockers).  
– Comfortable beds and quiet floors.  
– Manga-reading room and lounge are nice extras.  
– Excellent value for money so close to Tokyo.

What guests complain about  
– Surrounding streets feel a bit rough at night to some visitors.  
– Older vending machines / laundry; a few out of order.  
– Early check-in fee (about ¥2,000).  
– Occasional language barrier with staff.

Recent review snapshots  
• “Very comfortable for the price… security put me at ease… beds surprisingly comfy.” (Oct-2024)  
• “Super clean and quiet. Staff were very friendly.” (Oct-2024)  
• “Good location and price, but they charged me for early check-in.” (Oct-2024)

Good fit if… you want a budget-friendly, hostel-style stay with solid cleanliness and don’t mind commuting ~30 min into central Tokyo each day.

────────────────────────
2. “Cherry House” (direct to Narita / Haneda AP, Disney, etc.) – Matsudo  
• Location: residential Matsudo, ~19 km from Tokyo Tower; ~15-20 min walk to Goko Station, then 35-40 min train ride into Tokyo.  
• Price for 10 nights (mobile/weekly rate): ≈ US $235, incl. taxes.  
• Overall rating: 4.5 / 10 (“Disappointing”) from ≈ 52 reviews.

What guests like  
– Very low weekly/mobile rates.  
– Quiet neighbourhood; supermarkets & convenience stores nearby.  
– Host (“Tom-san”) often described as friendly/helpful.

What guests complain about  
– Dated house; many facilities in disrepair (only 1 working bathroom for several rooms, broken locks, AC tripping at night).  
– Weak room security (simple padlocks that can be removed).  
– No reception on arrival; self-check-in can be confusing.  
– Long walk to station → longer daily commute.  
– General cleanliness and maintenance issues.

Representative comments  
• “One has to realise it’s quite a commute into Tokyo; the price is good though.” (Nov-2023)  
• “Facilities are broken… AC turned off at night in −2 °C… overall I do not recommend.” (Dec-2022)  
• “Far from the train station; apartment needs refurbishment.” (May-2023)

Good fit if… ultra-low cost outweighs comfort, and you’re comfortable with very basic, aging shared facilities.

────────────────────────
Recommendation

• Hotel Plus Hostel TOKYO KAWASAKI is clearly the better-reviewed of the two and offers good cleanliness, security and value, albeit in a hostel setting.  
• “Cherry House” meets the budget but receives consistently poor scores due to maintenance and location drawbacks; consider only if price and a house-style stay are your overriding priorities.

Need more choices (e.g., raise budget slightly, look at private-room hotels, or adjust radius), or help booking and planning daily transport? Just let me know!

messages.content:
Here are the hotels that currently meet all your requirements  
• 50 km (or less) from the Atomic Bomb Dome  
• 10-night price between US $400 and US $500 for 15-25 December 2024  
• Available at time of search

────────────────────────────────────────
1. Chisun Hotel Hiroshima (ホテルID 313854)  
Approx. 1 km / 5 min by tram from the Atomic Bomb Dome  
Total price (10 nights): ≈ US $403 (incl. tax & fees)  
Overall score: 7.9 / 10  (“Good”, 3 000+ reviews)  

Quick review digest  
• What guests like  
  – Top-notch location: tram stop right outside; easy walk to Peace Park & central sights  
  – Very clean, well-kept rooms and bathrooms  
  – Staff consistently described as helpful and polite  
  – Good value for money for a city-centre stay  

• Typical drawbacks  
  – Rooms are compact (common in Japan); two large suitcases feel tight  
  – Bathrooms also on the small side  
  – Limited wardrobe / storage space  

Recent comments (Oct 2024)  
✓ “Room was clean and tidy… location was good with tram just outside.”  
✓ “Great base for sightseeing; good value.”  
✗ “Fine for a single traveller, cramped for two people and luggage.”  

Ideal for: families that plan to spend most of the day out sightseeing and want an easy, inexpensive base in the heart of Hiroshima.

────────────────────────────────────────
2. Green Rich Hotel Iwakuni Ekimae – Artificial Hot Spring Futamata Yunohana (ホテルID 2633073)  
Approx. 30 km south-west of the Dome (25 min by JR Sanyo Line + 5 min walk)  
Total price (10 nights): ≈ US $453 (incl. tax & fees)  
Overall score: 7.6 / 10  (“Good”, 1 000+ reviews)  

Quick review digest  
• What guests like  
  – 4- to 5-minute walk from JR Iwakuni Station; very convenient for day-tripping to Hiroshima, Miyajima and Kintai-kyo Bridge  
  – Public bath (artificial hot-spring “sento”) on site – a big plus after a day out  
  – Rooms larger than many Japanese business hotels; comfy lounge chairs mentioned  
  – Ample dining choices, convenience stores and supermarkets nearby  
  – Breakfast buffet gets frequent praise for variety and quality  

• Typical drawbacks  
  – Pillows and beds a bit firm for some western travellers  
  – Air-con only works when key card is in the slot (room warms up while you’re out)  
  – Still a business-hotel style property: no resort facilities, limited public spaces  

Recent comments (Oct–Nov 2024)  
✓ “Convenient and comfortable stop-over. Furo (bath) nice, breakfast very good.”  
✓ “My room was larger than expected! Great staff, clean.”  
✗ “If you want a resort experience, this is not the place.”  

Ideal for: families who don’t mind staying a little outside Hiroshima proper, want a quieter town, enjoy having a bath facility on site, and will use the train for day-trips.

────────────────────────────────────────
How to choose?

• If you want to be steps from the Peace Memorial Park and downtown Hiroshima, pick Chisun Hotel Hiroshima.  
• If you prefer slightly roomier accommodation, on-site bath, and don’t mind a 30-minute train ride into town each day, Green Rich Hotel Iwakuni Ekimae is a solid value.

Need more options or help securing a reservation? Let me know and I can search again or watch for price changes.

messages.content:
Here are the hotels that meet all of your criteria ( 1-10 Dec 2024, within 50 km of Sakurajima, total price 340-450 USD for the whole stay) together with a snapshot of what recent English-language guests are saying.

────────────────────────────────
1.  HOTEL NOIR Kagoshima Chuo Station  
   • Booking-price shown: ≈ 400 USD / 10 nts  
   • Guest score on Booking.com: 8.3/10 (≈ “Very good”, 500+ reviews)

   What guests like
   • 2–3 min walk to Kagoshima-Chūō Station; surrounded by convenience stores & restaurants.  
   • Very clean rooms; good sound insulation.  
   • Modern touches (motion-sensor corridor lights, efficient self check-in kiosks).  
   • Value for money for a city-center property.

   Common downsides
   • Typical Japanese business-hotel room size – will feel cramped when you open big suitcases.  
   • Desk/work-area is narrow; not ideal if you plan to work from the room.

────────────────────────────────
2.  Hotel Wing International Miyakonojo  
   • Booking-price shown: ≈ 344 USD / 10 nts (mobile rate)  
   • Guest score: 7.2/10 (“Good”, 350+ reviews)

   What guests like
   • 5-minute walk to JR Miyakonojo Station – convenient if you will be using the train.  
   • Helpful front-desk staff; quick to supply extra pillows, etc.  
   • Japanese / Western buffet breakfast gets frequent praise for variety and taste.  
   • Rooms equipped with YouTube-enabled TVs (mentioned in several 2024 reviews).

   Common downsides
   • Hotel can feel short-staffed late at night.  
   • Climate control is centrally managed; several guests found the rooms too warm in autumn.  
   • Building and rooms show their age – décor feels “business-hotel 1990s”.

────────────────────────────────
3.  Hotel Sunflex Kagoshima  
   • Booking-price shown: ≈ 373 USD / 10 nts (mobile rate)  
   • Guest score: 7.9/10 (“Good”, 2,200+ reviews)

   What guests like
   • On the waterfront, 7-10 min walk to Tenmonkan shopping arcade and to the Sakurajima ferry.  
   • Laundry room on site – handy for longer stays.  
   • Rooms described as “very clean, comfortable, well-appointed, and a good size for Japan”.  
   • Inexpensive breakfast buffet with Japanese & Western options.

   Common downsides
   • A few reports of scuffed / marked walls and low hallway bulkheads (tall guests mind your head).  
   • About 15-20 min walk (or short tram ride) from JR Kagoshima-Chūō Station.  
   • Some rooms on the smaller side for two adults plus luggage.

────────────────────────────────
How to choose?

• If you want to be right next to the main shinkansen/bus hub and don’t mind a compact room, HOTEL NOIR gets the most consistent praise for cleanliness and modernity.  
• If price is king, Hotel Wing Miyakonojo is the cheapest of the three, but note that it is 40-45 km from Sakurajima (still inside your 50 km radius) and the reviews reflect a more basic, older business hotel.  
• Hotel Sunflex strikes a balance: walking distance to both the ferry to Sakurajima and the downtown food/night-life area; rooms are a tad larger than HOTEL NOIR, but the property is older.

Feel free to tell me which one you prefer (or ask for more details such as room photos, cancellation terms, etc.) and I’ll help you take the next step.

messages.content:
Here’s what I found when I ran a price-filtered search (US $200–400 for the whole 9-night stay) within a 30 km radius of Osaka Castle for 1–10 Dec 2024:

=================================================
1.  Hotel Mikado
   • Category: Budget (1-star) “business hotel”/hostel hybrid  
   • Location: Shin-Imamiya area – about 4.7 km southwest of Osaka Castle, 1-2 min walk to Dobutsuen-Mae subway & JR Shin-Imamiya stations  
   • Total cost (9 nights, 1 room, 2 adults): ~US $228 all-in (≈US $25/night)  
   • Guest rating: 7.6 / 10 (“Good”) from ~1,340 reviews
   • Room types in this price range: Single or small-twin Japanese-style rooms with shared bathrooms

Review take-aways (drawn from the most relevant & recent 25 English-language reviews):

What guests like
• Excellent transit access – multiple subway/JR lines within a block; easy reach of Namba, Dotonbori, Tennoji and Osaka Castle  
• Surroundings full of inexpensive eateries, 24 h convenience stores and vending machines  
• Very low room rate – “great price/quality ratio,” “super cheap”  
• Friendly, English-capable front desk staff  
• Free extras considered good for the price: sauna, basic communal kitchen, coin laundry, bicycle hire

Recurring downsides
• Small, worn rooms; thin walls – typical of old Japanese budget hotels  
• All lower-priced rooms share bathrooms/toilets; some guests noted hair or odor issues when cleaning lagged  
• Cigarette vending machine in the hallway and a lingering smoke smell in a few rooms (even though advertised non-smoking)  
• Kitchen/common areas can get cluttered unless staff happen to be cleaning that day

Family-friendliness snapshot
• Pros: extraordinarily cheap, safe neighborhood, easy transport, private lockable rooms (not dorms)  
• Cons: no ensuite bathrooms, space is very tight for luggage or for kids to move around; overall hostel vibe rather than family-oriented hotel

=================================================

No other properties met every filter (location ≤ 30 km, price $200-$400 for nine nights) in the data set, so Hotel Mikado is the only hotel that satisfies your budget/location window.

Recommendation for your family trip
• If your top priority is minimising cost and you’re fine with basic, shared-facility accommodation, Hotel Mikado is acceptable and well located.  
• If you prefer a larger private room or an in-room bathroom, consider widening the budget ceiling a little (above ~US $400 total) or shortening the stay at a mid-range hotel. Even moving the price filter up to ≈US $500–700 typically reveals many 3-star family-friendly hotels around Osaka Castle.

messages.content:
Here are the hotels that meet your requirements (within 10 km of Kinkaku-ji, US $100-300 total for your 10-night stay, 2 adults, 1 room) and a digest of their most recent guest feedback.

────────────────────────────────
1. Piece Hostel Sanjo
   • Distance from Kinkaku-ji (approx.): 4.1 km
   • Total price shown for 10 nights (incl. VAT, excl. city tax): about US $254
   • Rating: 8.9 / 10 (4 900+ reviews) – “Fabulous”
   • Typical plus points
        – Very clean modern hostel-hotel hybrid
        – English-speaking, helpful staff (several guests praised “Toshi”)
        – Central Kyoto location—easy to reach buses and subway
        – Comfy beds and good common lounge / kitchen
   • Typical minus points
        – Private rooms and dorm pods are compact; limited luggage space
        – Complimentary drinks are mostly tea; some guests wished for coffee
   • Recent review snippets
        – “Everything as expected, would use again.” (Family, GB)
        – “Super clean and well designed.” (Couple, IL)
        – “Good location, neat and clean, but storage room for luggage is tight.” (Couple, AU)
        – “Nice hostel at the heart of Kyoto… would stay here again.” (Solo, HU)
        – “Beds nice, everything clean, but room was small.” (Group of friends, NL)

At the moment, Piece Hostel Sanjo is the only property returned by Booking.com that satisfies all the filters (price, dates, radius, party size). Availability in Kyoto over early February—a peak tourism time because of plum-blossom season and the Chinese New Year wave—can be tight and prices can jump quickly. If your budget ceiling is flexible or you are willing to stay slightly farther away (e.g., 15 km) or choose twin instead of double rooms, many more options will appear.

Next steps / tips
• If you like Piece Hostel Sanjo, consider booking a cancellable rate soon; you can always change later.
• If you prefer a hotel (not hostel) or need more space, widening the radius to 15 km or raising your max price to ~US $400–450 for 10 nights will surface full-service hotels in downtown Kyoto, Arashiyama, and around Kyoto Station.
• Let me know if you’d like me to run a broader search (different budget, star rating, breakfasts included, multiple rooms, etc.) or pull detailed individual reviews for this property.

Hope this helps you get your Kyoto plans rolling!

messages.content:
Here’s what I found for 15–25 November 2024 within 40 km of Nagoya Castle and a total-stay budget of US$100–300:   

Hotel (only match in this price band)  
• Guesthouse Kiten – Gifu City (≈26 km / 40 min by train or car from Nagoya Castle)  
 • Total price shown for 10 nights: ¥35,000 ≈ US$234 (all taxes/fees included)  
 • Category: 2-star, hostel/guest-house style – mainly dormitory beds (shared bathroom)  
 • Overall review score: 8.7 / 10 (“Fabulous”, 256 reviews)

Recent English-language guest comments

Positives  
• Location is excellent for sightseeing around Gifu and still close enough to reach Nagoya easily.  
• Staff repeatedly praised as “super-friendly”, “very helpful”, and great at recommending food and activities.  
• Traditional, tastefully restored building; described as “charming”, “cozy” and “unique”.  
• Clean dorms, comfortable beds, good value for money.  
• Free bike rental appreciated by several guests.

Negatives / things to note  
• Only one shower and small washrooms – can create queues when the house is full.  
• Being a guest-house/hostel, most rooms are bunk beds in mixed or female dormitories; this may not suit every family (you’d need to book multiple beds or check if the property can offer a private family room).  

If this accommodation style works for your family, Guesthouse Kiten fits all the criteria and gets consistently positive feedback for hospitality, cleanliness and atmosphere; just be prepared for shared facilities.  

Would you like help finding options in a higher price band (there are many more traditional hotels in Nagoya city itself), or assistance with booking transport and activities during your stay?

2. Palace Inn Blue Houston East Beltway 8

   • Category / style: 4-star, modern roadside hotel  
   • Guest rating: 8.7 / 10 (“Fabulous”)  
   • Typical price 1–6 Nov: about US $846 per double-queen room (excl. ≈15 % tax). Free cancellation.  
   • Rooms & layout: Spacious double-queen and king rooms; some kitchenettes. All have flat-screen cable TV, coffee maker, fridge, writing desk.

3. Sleep Inn & Suites Pearland – Houston South

Notes & next steps

   • Snapshot: Opened 2021 in the Historic Core. Smart-tech rooms controlled by an iPad, XL king beds, rain showers, sound-proofing, free ultra-fast Wi-Fi. 24-hour canteenM bar/restaurant, work-lounge, self-check-in kiosks, fitness partnership with a nearby gym. Buffet breakfast available (extra).  
   • Good for: quick access to Downtown, Microsoft Theater, Crypto.com Arena (ex-Staples), and light-rail (Pershing Square & Union Station).  

2. LA Crystal Hotel – Los Angeles / Long Beach Area (Carson)  
   • Distance from Convention Center: ≈ 19 km – about 20 min by car (traffic permitting).  
   • Category / rating: 3-star hotel – review score 7.9 (“Good”, 3 600+ reviews).  
   • Price: about US $1 302 + US $98 taxes & fees (total ≈ US $1 400) for two rooms / five nights.  Breakfast included.  
   • Snapshot: High-rise property just off I-405 with outdoor pool & hot-tub, small casino, lobby bar, complimentary parking, and a simple fitness room. Rooms have mini-fridge, flat-screen TV, A/C; kettles available on request.  24-hour front desk; LAX and Long Beach Airport each ~20 min away.  
   • Good for: groups needing free parking, quick freeway access to both LA & OC, and a lower price point that still includes breakfast.  

3. Crowne Plaza Hotel Los Angeles Harbor, an IHG Hotel (San Pedro)  
   • Distance from Convention Center: ≈ 34 km – 30 – 35 min by car.  
   • Category / rating: 4-star hotel – review score 7.7 (“Good”, 1 100+ reviews).

   • Snapshot: Overlooks Port of Los Angeles, 4 blocks from World Cruise Center. Outdoor pool, complete fitness center, full-service Blu Restaurant & Lounge (breakfast, lunch, dinner), 24-hour business center. Rooms have work desk, coffee maker, free Wi-Fi. On-site parking (surcharge). Good base if you’d like to explore coastal areas such as Long Beach Aquarium or visit Catalina Island ferry.  
   • Good for: travelers who prefer a full-service hotel with IHG perks, or who will add beach / harbor activities to their itinerary.  

Next steps / tips  
• All three properties show 2-room availability for your exact dates; rates can change quickly, so lock in refundable options if you need flexibility.

Staff speak English, Spanish, Gujarati and Hindi at the reception.

Dallas Holocaust Museum is 22 km from the accommodation, while Dallas World Aquarium is 22 km from the property.

messages.content:
Here are two available hotels that match your dates (05–10 Dec 2024), can supply three rooms, and sit well inside the 50-km radius around the Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center:

──────────────────────────────────
1. La Quinta by Wyndham Dallas Duncanville
• Approx. distance to Convention Center: 17 km (≈ 20 min by car).
• Category: 3-star; opened in 2019.  
• What guests like:
  – Indoor heated pool & hot tub (great for December).  
  – Daily hot breakfast (included).  
  – Free high-speed Wi-Fi, parking and 24-hour fitness room.  
  – Front desk staff speak English, Spanish, Gujarati & Hindi.  
  – Pet-friendly (fee – $25 /night; max 2 pets, 75 lb each).  
• Room facts for your stay:
  – Three standard king or two-queen rooms are currently available.  
  – Free cancellation before the arrival day.  
  – Check-in from 15:00; check-out until 11:00.  
• At-a-glance description (provider text):  
  “La Quinta by Wyndham Dallas Duncanville offers air-conditioned rooms with private bathrooms and free Wi-Fi. Guests enjoy an indoor pool, fitness centre and shared lounge. Dallas Zoo is 17 km away; Sixth Floor Museum, JFK Memorial and other downtown sights are about 21–22 km.”

──────────────────────────────────
2. La Quinta by Wyndham Waxahachie
• Approx. distance to Convention Center: 40 km (≈ 35 min by car, straight shot up I-35E).  
• Category: 3-star.  
• What guests like:
  – Seasonal outdoor pool & hot tub.  
  – Daily hot breakfast buffet (included).  
  – Free Wi-Fi, guest laundry and small fitness room.  
  – Plenty of free parking; easy access to restaurants and shops off US-287.  
  – Pet-friendly (same $25 /night, max $75 per stay).  
• Room facts for your stay:
  – Three standard rooms (king or two-queen) showing as available.  
  – Free cancellation and “no pre-payment” option.  
  – Check-in from 15:00; check-out until 11:00.  
• At-a-glance description (provider text):  
  “Featuring a seasonal outdoor pool, La Quinta Inn & Suites Waxahachie is a 5-minute walk from Lumpkin Stadium. All rooms include free Wi-Fi, cable TV, coffee maker and private bath. Guests can relax in the hot tub, use the fitness centre or coin laundry. Southwestern Assemblies of God University is 5 min away; downtown Dallas is about 35 min.”

──────────────────────────────────
Why they fit your group
• Both properties still show availability for three rooms across the requested nights.  
• Together they give you a choice of staying closer (Duncanville) or in a quieter suburb with lower nightly cost (Waxahachie).  
• Each offers free breakfast, Wi-Fi and parking, which keeps group logistics simple.  
• Both allow free cancellation, handy if travel plans shift.

Next steps
Let me know which hotel you prefer (or if you’d like alternative options), and I can provide booking links, room configurations, or transportation tips between the hotel and the convention center.

data.description:
Marshall Suites is located in the heart of Bainbridge, 14 km from Seattle. Free WiFi is provided.

All rooms include a TV with cable channels, a microwave, and is fitted with a private bathroom equipped with a bath or shower.

Bellevue is 25 km from Marshall Suites, while Lynnwood is 27 km from the property. Sea-Tac Airport is 27 km away.

Please note the property only accepts dogs weighing a maximum of 36 kg.

The Washington State Ferry will not be in service from September 7, 2023, to September 13, 2023.  If you are planning on using the ferry as transportation to/ from Bainbridge Island during your stay please contact us for other transportation options.
Please note: Parking is for hotel guests only. Please see the polices section for parking rates.

Stay in the heart of Seattle.
Located just 10 minutes' walk away from The Space Needle, The Mediterranean Inn features a rooftop patio with panoramic views of the Seattle Skyline, Mount Rainier, the Olympic Mountains, and Elliot Bay. A fitness centre is located on site.

All guest rooms at this hotel include a flat-screen TV, full sized work desk, a microwave, small refrigerator, coffee maker, and kitchenette. All rooms include en-suite bathrooms that include hairdryers.

A 24-hour reception greets guests of The Mediterranean Inn.  A business centre and 24-hour laundry facilities are provided to guests. Vending machines featuring snacks and drinks are available. Coffee is available in the lobby.

Pike Place Market is 2 km away from this hotel. Hosting sports and entertainment events, KeyArena is 3 minutes’ walk away.

Please note that only service animals are allowed. Guests need to inform about the service animal before arrival.


The property accepts credit cards and debit cards. Cash is not accepted.

When booking more than 10 rooms, different policies and additional supplements may apply.

Stay in the heart of Seattle.
Situated conveniently in the South Lake Union district of Seattle, citizenM Seattle South Lake Union is set 1 km from Space Needle, 1.4 km from Seattle Center and 1.5 km from Pike Place Market. Among the facilities of this property are a restaurant, a 24-hour front desk and a shared lounge, along with free high speed WiFi throughout the property. The property is close to popular attractions like Port of Seattle, KeyArena and International Fountain.

The hotel will provide guests with air-conditioned rooms offering a desk, a safety deposit box, a flat-screen TV and a private bathroom with a shower.
With the room iPad, or the free citizenM app, all guests can control room lights, black-out blinds, curtains, temperature, as well as TV and radio channels. They can also stream from their own Netflix, Prime or Disney+ accounts (and many others), by connecting their phone, tablet or laptop to the TV via Chromecast (at no extra charge).

At citizenM Seattle South Lake Union all rooms are equipped with bed linen and towels.

The accommodation offers a buffet or vegetarian breakfast.

A business centre and ironing facilities are available at citizenM Seattle South Lake Union.

Popular points of interest near the hotel include Museum of Pop Culture, Washington State Convention Center and Westlake Center. The nearest airport is Boeing Field/King County International Airport, 12 km from citizenM Seattle South Lake Union.

messages.content:
Here are three properties that have availability for 2 rooms, 15 – 20 November 2024, and sit within 40 km of the Washington State Convention Center (WSCC).  All are fully cancellable at the time of search.

————————————————
1) citizenM Seattle South Lake Union  
• Distance from WSCC: ≈ 1 km (10-12 min walk; 3-4 min by rideshare)  
• Category / rating: 4-star, Review score 8.7 / 10 (“Fabulous”, 2 400+ reviews)  
• Typical cost for your dates (2 rooms, 5 nights): about US $1 258 total (≈ US $126 per room / night) – taxes & city fees add ≈ US $226.  
• Why consider it?  
  – Ultra-modern, tech-centric rooms; iPad (or the citizenM app) controls lights, blinds, TV & temperature and casts your own Netflix/Prime/Disney+.  
  – Queen bed with high-quality linens; powerful rain shower.  
  – 24-hr canteenM lobby bar/restaurant, buffet & vegetarian breakfast, plenty of communal coworking tables.  
  – Roof-to-ceiling windows in many rooms; some peek toward Lake Union.  
  – Fast Wi-Fi, stylish lounges, 24-hr reception, business corner, self-service check-in kiosks.  
• Good to know: No parking on-site; nearest garages 1–2 blocks away.  Only service animals permitted.  Cash not accepted.

Property description excerpt:  
“Situated in South Lake Union, citizenM offers air-conditioned rooms with an iPad to control lighting, blinds and Chromecast-enabled TV.  A buffet breakfast is available and guests have access to a 24-hour shared lounge and work space.  Popular points of interest such as the Space Needle, Pike Place Market and the Washington State Convention Center are within easy reach.”

————————————————
2) The Mediterranean Inn (Seattle, Queen Anne)  
• Distance from WSCC: ≈ 2.4 km (25-30 min walk; 8-10 min by car or Monorail)  
• Category / rating: 3-star, Review score 8.6 / 10 (“Fabulous”, 3 800+ reviews)  
• Typical cost for your dates (2 rooms, 5 nights): about US $1 446 total (≈ US $145 per room / night) – taxes & local fees add ≈ US $386.  
• Why consider it?  
  – Rooftop terrace with sweeping 360° views of downtown skyline, Mount Rainier, Olympic Mountains & Elliott Bay – favorite sunset spot.  
  – Kitchenette in every room (microwave, mini-fridge, coffee maker, sink) – handy for quick breakfasts or late-night snacks.  
  – 24-hr fitness room; coin-op laundry; business center; lobby coffee.  
  – Steps to Seattle Center/Space Needle, cafés and casual dining in Lower Queen Anne.  
• Good to know: On-site parking garage for guests only (USD 25 + tax per night last posted).  No breakfast service but adjacent Starbucks and plentiful eateries.

Property description excerpt:  
“Located just a 10-minute walk from the Space Needle, The Mediterranean Inn features a rooftop patio with panoramic views.  All guest rooms include a flat-screen TV, full work desk and kitchenette.  24-hour reception, business centre and laundry facilities are on site; coffee is available in the lobby.”

————————————————
3) Marshall Suites (Bainbridge Island)  
• Distance from WSCC: ≈ 16 km straight-line; travel time ≈ 45–55 min via Seattle–Bainbridge ferry + short drive (ferry terminal is 10-min walk from WSCC).  
• Category / rating: 3-star, Review score 8.2 / 10 (“Very good”, 530+ reviews)  
• Typical cost for your dates (2 suites, 5 nights): about US $1 501 total (≈ US $150 per suite / night) – taxes add ≈ US $196.  
• Why consider it?  
  – Quiet, small-town setting away from city bustle; short stroll to Winslow’s restaurants, bakeries and waterfront.  
  – All-suite property; each has separate seating area, microwave, mini-fridge and coffee station – extra working space for research prep.  
  – Complimentary parking & Wi-Fi; fitness room.  
  – Bainbridge Island offers charming shops, wine-tasting rooms and parks if you have downtime.  
• Good to know: Reaching Seattle requires the Washington State Ferry (35 min crossing; pedestrian fare about US $10 round-trip).  The hotel accepts dogs up to 80 lbs for a pet fee.

Property description excerpt:  
“Marshall Suites is located in the heart of Bainbridge, 14 km from Seattle.  All rooms include a TV, microwave and private bathroom.  Free Wi-Fi and parking are provided.”

————————————————
Next steps / tips
• Availability & rates can change quickly; if any of these suit you, consider reserving soon (all three currently allow free cancellation).  
• If you prefer to be walking-distance to the convention center, citizenM or Mediterranean Inn are the best fits.  Marshall Suites is attractive if you’d like a more relaxed island atmosphere and don’t mind the ferry commute.  
• Need ground transport?  Link Light Rail connects Westlake Station (5 min walk from WSCC) to SEA airport in ~38 min for US $3.  Rideshare from the downtown hotels takes ~20–25 min depending on traffic; from Bainbridge Island, taxi or rideshare is needed between the ferry dock and hotel (≈ 5 min).  

Let me know if you’d like additional options, airport-hotel transfers, or help securing a booking!

messages.content:
Here are several Adelaide properties that (a) list “Family rooms” in the hotel facilities, (b) show “Electric kettle” in the in-room amenities, and (c) have availability for 15 – 22 December 2024 for two adults + two children aged 5 & 8.  Prices are the total cost for the seven-night stay, shown in USD exactly as returned by the search; they will be converted to AUD and may fluctuate.

1. Toms Court Hotel – Adelaide CBD  
   • 4-star | Review score 8.2 (Very good, 2 563 reviews)  
   • Family Room option with three beds (1 queen + 2 singles) – electric kettle, microwave, mini-fridge.  
   • Walk-to-everything location on King William St (central market area).  
   • Sample price: ≈ US $1 270 for 7 nights, free Wi-Fi, paid parking nearby.

2. Quality Apartments Adelaide Central – Adelaide CBD  
   • 4-star | Review score 8.5 (Very good, 1 793 reviews)  
   • One-bedroom apartment that sleeps 4 (king/queen bed + sofa-bed or roll-aways); has full kitchenette with electric kettle, cook-top & washer/dryer.  
   • Right off Rundle Mall (shops, eateries at your door).  
   • Free cancellation, pay-on-arrival. ≈ US $1 168.

3. The Chancellor on Currie – Adelaide CBD  
   • 4-star | Review score 8.2 (Very good, 2 033 reviews)  
   • Family Quad Room (2 double beds) with electric kettle, fridge and bathtub.  
   • Historic boutique hotel in a 1920s bank building; pool & small fitness room.  
   • Late-escape deal showing ≈ US $ 691 (big value play).

4. Majestic M Suites – North Adelaide (about 2.4 km from centre)  
   • 5-star apartment-style | Review score 9.3 (Superb, 1 763 reviews)  
   • Two-bedroom, two-bathroom suite (86 m²) – full kitchen with kettle, dishwasher, laundry, balcony.  
   • Modern building; secure parking; playground in nearby parklands.  
   • ≈ US $1 812.

5. Adelaide International Motel – Glenelg South / Anzac Hwy (≈ 9 km to CBD, 1.5 km to beach)  
   • 3-star | Review score 8.6 (Fabulous, 1 202 reviews)  
   • Family Room with up to 4 separate beds, fridge, kettle, toaster.  
   • Small outdoor pool, free on-site parking, easy tram ride to city.  
   • ≈ US $1 262.

Key notes & next steps
• All five properties explicitly list both “Family rooms” and an “Electric kettle” on Booking.com’s room-amenities filter.  
• Availability and prices can change quickly—book early for school-holiday dates.  
• Check bed configuration carefully when you select the exact room; some “family” units use sofa-beds or roll-aways.  
• If you prefer breakfast included, adjoining rooms, or a pool, apply those filters before you reserve.  
• Always review the cancellation policy and whether payment is due now or at the property.

Let me know if you’d like more options, different price points, or help arranging airport transfers and activities in Adelaide!

available.mealplan: Breakfast included in the price

result.pros: The staff was very friendly and room was big enough equipped with coffee machine. There was also underground parking with elevator access.. breakfast was ok there were choices between pastry, cereals yogurt.
result.title: Pleasant
result.cons: the area feels creepy and it's is definitely dangerous to go around .. especially if you planning to use the railway/metro better avoid night hours.. Hotel renovation but it's comfortable in general..the ventilation system was noisy

result.pros: Price
result.title: Pay more and stay at better place
result.cons:
I was staying on 4th floor and I didn’t find it clean at all. Water had rust coming in and all facilities helped was to say keep it running.So for 3 hours we had water in sink and shower running.Our room smelled bad.
Microwave is in the hallway and not in room due to which you will smell weird food mixed smells all the time

result.pros: Parking gratis, restaurante buen precio en el mismo hotel
result.cons: La zona, lejos de la ciudad y zona si sales por la noche no muy segura. Hotel antiguo, falta reforma.
result.title: Calidad precio bien, pero no volveria

result.pros:
Super hôtel 5 étoiles 
Chambre spacieuse et confortable 
Parking fermé, petit déjeuner varié 
Prix très intéressant 
Personnel accueillant et enregistrement rapide
result.cons: Rien de spécial
result.title: Magnifique séjour en famille

messages.content:
Here’s one solid, budget-friendly option that meets your “within 20 km of LAX” requirement and still has rooms for the night of 14 → 15 Nov 2024.

──────────────────
LA Crystal Hotel – Los Angeles/Long Beach Area  
(Hotel ID 1194086 | **≈ 18 km / 11 mi** from LAX, about 20-25 min by car outside heavy traffic)

Category / rating: 3-star ‑ “Good” 7.9/10 (3,600+ reviews)  
Perks: free parking, breakfast included, outdoor pool, 24-h front desk, on-site bar/restaurant.  
Check-in: from 15:00 Check-out: until 12:00 – handy for an early flight.

ROOMS AVAILABLE – Thu 14 → Fri 15 Nov 2024 (1 adult, 1 room)

1) Luxury King Room  
• 28 m² │ 1 King bed │ Non-smoking  
• Breakfast included (continental & hot items)  
• Free cancellation until 23:59 on 12 Nov (property time)  
• “Pay nothing until 10 Nov” – then full pre-payment charged  
• Price: US $130.20 room rate + US $9.76 tax ≈ **US $140 total**

2) Luxury Two Double Bed Room  
• 28 m² │ 2 Double beds │ Sleeps up to 4  
• Same meal plan & cancellation terms as above  
• Price: US $140.12 room rate + US $10.51 tax ≈ **US $151 total**

POLICY SNAPSHOT  
• Free cancellation up to 1 day before arrival; afterwards full stay is charged.  
• Payment captured on/after 10 Nov unless you choose to pay at booking.  
• Breakfast included; no resort fee; parking is complimentary.

LATEST USER FEEDBACK (sorted Newest → Oldest, Oct 2024)

“Pleasant” (2.8/5) – Liked friendly staff, big room, free parking; thought the neighborhood felt unsafe at night and HVAC was noisy.  
“Pay more and stay at better place” (1.6/5) – Praised low price; complained about room smell, rusty water, hallway microwave odors.  
“Calidad precio bien, pero no volvería” (2.8/5) – Free parking & cheap restaurant good; location far from city sights, hotel needs a facelift.  
“Exceptional” (4/5) – Positive overall, no specific negatives noted.  
“Magnifique séjour en famille” (3.2/5) – Spacious comfortable room, secure parking, varied breakfast, friendly staff; “Rien de spécial” to dislike.

Common themes: Good value and breakfast; mixed cleanliness/maintenance remarks; area feels industrial—fine for an airport lay-over but not for city strolling at night.

WHY IT FITS YOUR PLAN  
✓ <20 km from LAX – quick Uber/Lyft (~US $25-35) or taxi at 06:00-07:00 should still reach the terminals easily.  
✓ Late check-out (noon) lets you rest if your flight isn’t ultra-early.  
✓ Free parking if you’re driving yourself.  
✓ Breakfast from ~06:30 means you can grab a bite before heading out.

If you’d like something a bit higher-end (e.g., the Hyatt Regency or Courtyard by Marriott near LAX), prices rise to US $230+ for your date, but the LA Crystal gives you a clean bed, breakfast and a sub-US $150 all-in rate close to the airport.

I need to catch a flight that takes off from Idlewild Airport in New York on December 1, 2024, tomorrow morning. I plan to stay at a hotel near the airport tonight. Recommend a hotel that's less than 30 kilometers from the airport, and check the details of the available rooms and the latest user reviews for this hotel.

result.title: Very good
result.pros: Das Frühstück war einfach - aber wir mussten ja frühmorgens auf den Flughafen. Dieses Hotel haben wir aufgrund der Nähe zum Flughafen gewählt - mit dem tollen Shuttle-Service.

Kort bij de luchthaven, bent er binnen 15 minuten.
Kamer basic maar prima voor 1 nacht.
result.title: Prima om te overnachten als je op San Francisco vliegt.
result.cons: Ontbijt opties zijn karig. Ontbijtruimte nodigt ook niet echt uit.

result.pros: The place felt clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly. The hotel had everything we needed. Our room was quiet and there was little light that came through the curtains when they are closed. We had a good night's rest. The breakfast was good. I was happily surprised to see they served frozen omelettes and pancakes, I thought there would just be toast and cereal. 24hr drink station was an excellent surprise.

stayed_room_info.room_name: Business Queen Room with Two Queen Beds - Non-Smoking

result.title: Would stay here again
result.cons: We missed the last shuttle at 11:30pm and had to take a Lyft. I wish I could see the shuttle information easier and earlier on emails and when booking.

messages.content:
Here’s a solid, practical option that meets all of your criteria for tonight (19 Nov 2024) before your early-morning flight on 20 Nov 2024.

────────────────
RECOMMENDED HOTEL
────────────────
Hotel 1550 – SFO Airport West  
• Category: 3-star, modern roadside hotel in San Bruno  
• Distance from SFO terminals: ≈ 3 km (under 10 min by car; free half-hourly shuttle 04:00-23:30)  
• Address: 1550 El Camino Real, San Bruno, CA 94066  
• Check-in/Out: 15:00 / 11:00  
• Free Wi-Fi | Free on-site parking | 24 h coffee/tea | Continental breakfast included (starts 06:00, grab-&-go items available earlier)  

───────────────
AVAILABLE ROOMS (for 1 night – 19 → 20 Nov 2024, 1 room / up to 2 adults unless noted)
───────────────
1. King Room – Non-Smoking  
   • Bed: 1 King | 28 m²  
   • Price tonight: US $155.10 + approx. US $22.74 taxes / fees  
   • Breakfast included  
   • Payment: pay at property, no pre-payment  
   • Cancellation: was free until 18 Nov 23:59; after that full stay is charged if you cancel/no-show.  
   • Availability: plenty (20 rooms left)

2. King Room – Mobility Access, Non-Smoking  
   • Same rate & policies as above  
   • Accessibility features (wider doorway, grab bars)  
   • Only 3 rooms left

3. Standard Queen Room with 2 Queen Beds – Non-Smoking (sleeps 4)  
   • Rate: US $163.20 + taxes (~US $23.95)  
   • Breakfast, pay-at-property, same cancellation policy  
   • 10 rooms left

4. Business King Room – Non-Smoking  
   • Rate: US $166.80 + taxes (~US $24.49)  
   • Breakfast, pay-at-property, same cancellation policy  
   • 7 rooms left

5. Business Queen Room with 2 Queen Beds – Non-Smoking (sleeps 4)  
   • Rate: US $172.20 + taxes (~US $25.30)  
   • Breakfast, pay-at-property, same cancellation policy  
   • 10 rooms left

All listed prices already include the property’s “mobile-only” 10 % discount and US $3/night service charge; taxes/fees are paid at check-out.

───────────────
LATEST GUEST REVIEWS  (sorted newest → oldest, Oct 2024)
───────────────
• 22 Oct 2024 – Heidi  (Switzerland)  – 8/10  
  “Chose it for proximity to airport; the shuttle service was great. Adequate simple breakfast for an early flight.”

• 22 Oct 2024 – Marianne  (Switzerland) – 8/10  
  Also praised airport access; overall “very good” for one-night stay.

• 21 Oct 2024 – Ernst  (Netherlands) – 7/10  
  “Perfect for overnight before flight; basic room. Breakfast options limited; breakfast room not very inviting.”

• 21 Oct 2024 – Christina  (USA, family) – 9/10  
  Liked cleanliness, quiet rooms, friendly staff. Breakfast better than expected (omelettes, pancakes). Tip: last shuttle leaves at 23:30 – they missed it and had to Lyft.

• 21 Oct 2024 – Igor  (UAE) – 5/10  
  Found the stay just “passable”; (no detailed comments shown here).

Overall review score: 8.2 / 10 (“Very good”) from ~3,900 reviews. Guests consistently like the cleanliness, staff friendliness, and location near SFO; common minor downsides are limited breakfast variety and small breakfast area.

───────────────
WHY THIS PLACE WORKS FOR YOU
───────────────
✓ < 40 km from SFO (actually ~3 km) – minimizes transfer time.  
✓ Same-day booking still has several room choices.  
✓ Free airport shuttle starting 04:00 – ideal for an early departure.  
✓ Free parking if you’re driving.  
✓ Continental breakfast & 24-h coffee make a 05-06 am departure easy.  
✓ Pay-at-property, so no charge today if your plans suddenly change (but note the cancellation window has closed).

If you’d like to reserve, choose the room type that suits you above; all are smoke-free and include breakfast. Have a smooth stay and a stress-free flight tomorrow!

I need to catch a flight that takes off from O'Hare International Airport in Chicago on December 10, 2024, tomorrow morning. I plan to stay at a hotel near the airport tonight. Recommend a hotel that's less than 50 kilometers from the airport, and check the details of the available rooms and the latest user reviews for this hotel.

messages.content:
Recommended hotel within 50 km of O’Hare for the night of Mon 9 Dec 2024 (check-out Tue 10 Dec 2024)

Hotel: SureStay Plus Hotel by Best Western Chicago Lombard  
• Distance from ORD: ≈17 km / 25 min drive (west on I-290/I-294).  
• Category / score: 3-star, overall rating 8.3 / 10 (“Very good”, 1 100+ reviews).  
• Extras: Hot buffet breakfast included in all rates, free parking & Wi-Fi, 24 h front desk, early-morning coffee station – useful for a dawn flight.

Available rooms (checked 22 Oct 2024; 1 adult, 1 night)

| Room type (all non-smoking, 1 queen bed, 27 m²) | # rooms left | Price (night) | Taxes/fees* | Pay/Cancel rules | Good to know |
|-------------------------------------------------|-------------|---------------|-------------|------------------|--------------|
| Queen Room – Disability Access | 5 | US $90.24 | ≈US $9.93 | NON-REFUNDABLE, pay at booking | Flexible 1-time date change (until 6 Dec) |
| Queen Room – Disability Access | 5 | US $94.99 | ≈US $10.45 | FREE CXL until 00:00 09 Dec; pay 6 Dec | “Pay-later” option until 23:59 06 Dec |
| Queen Room – Standard | 5 | US $90.24 | ≈US $9.93 | NON-REFUNDABLE, pay at booking | Same as first row |
| Queen Room – Standard | 5 | US $94.99 | ≈US $10.45 | FREE CXL until 00:00 09 Dec; pay 6 Dec | Same pay-later option |
| Queen Room w/ Roll-in Shower (accessible) | 1 | US $90.24 | ≈US $9.93 | NON-REFUNDABLE, pay at booking | Only one room left |

*Total you’ll see at check-out is Price + Taxes/fees (≈US $100–105).

Latest (most recent first) user reviews – October 2024

1. “It’s fine for a quick one-night stay, but beds could be more comfortable.”  
   • 20 Oct 2024, Solo traveller, score 2.4/5  
   • + Convenient location, familiar property. – Uncomfortable mattress, end-of-hall noise.

2. “Pleasant.”  
   • 20 Oct 2024, Family, score 2.8/5  
   • Mixed, no detailed comments.

3. “Will not stay here again.”  
   • 19 Oct 2024, Couple, score 0.4/5  
   • + Friendly staff. – Room odor, stained sheets, bugs.

4. “What a hotel stay should feel like.”  
   • 18 Oct 2024, Solo traveller, score 4/5  
   • + Helpful staff, nearby pizza place & Metra station, easy amenities. – Nothing negative.

5. “Pense bem.” (Portuguese)  
   • 17 Oct 2024, Family, score 2.8/5  
   • + Good for shopping; near outlets & stores. – Room, bathroom & breakfast could improve.

Take-aways
• Most recent comments vary: staff & location get praise, but a few guests mention cleanliness or bedding comfort.  
• If you want a risk-free booking, pick one of the “Free cancellation / Pay later” options and cancel before midnight Mon 9 Dec.  
• Leave by about 04:30–05:00 for an early-morning departure at O’Hare; traffic is usually light at that hour (≈25 min).  
• Request an upper-floor, interior room for quiet and inspect linens at check-in—staff are noted as responsive to issues.

Let me know if you’d like alternative hotels, driving directions, or a taxi estimate.

I need to catch a flight that takes off from Toronto Pearson International Airport on November 25, 2024, tomorrow morning. I plan to stay at a hotel near the airport tonight. Recommend a hotel that's less than 10 kilometers from the airport, and check the details of the available rooms and the latest user reviews for this hotel.

messages.content:
Recommended hotel for tonight (24 Nov 2024) within 10 km of Toronto Pearson International Airport

Hotel: Quality Inn Toronto Airport (★★)
• Distance from YYZ: ≈1.5 km (5-min free shuttle ride; 24 h service every 30 min).  
• Guest rating: 7.4/10 (“Good”) from 5,300+ reviews.  
• Check-in: from 16:00 • Check-out: by 11:00  
• Free hot breakfast, Wi-Fi, fitness room; on-site bar & grill; guestrooms are non-smoking.

Tonight’s available rooms & prices (24 → 25 Nov 2024, 1 adult)  
All rates include breakfast; taxes/fees shown separately; pay in CAD at property unless stated.

1. Queen Room + Sofa-bed (Non-refundable, pay online)  
   • Sleeps 1-2 • 19 m²  
   • CAD 139.32 room + CAD 28.78 taxes/fees ≈ CAD 168.11 (≈ US $122)  
   • No changes/refund after booking.

2. Queen Room + Sofa-bed (FREE cancellation until 16:00 today, pay at property)  
   • Sleeps 1-2 • 19 m²  
   • CAD 163.90 room + CAD 33.87 taxes/fees ≈ CAD 197.76 (≈ US $143)  
   • Cancel without charge until 16:00, 24 Nov; no pre-payment required.

3. Double Room with Two Double Beds (Non-refundable, pay online) – only 1 left  
   • Sleeps up to 2 • 19 m²  
   • CAD 130.82 room + CAD 27.03 taxes/fees ≈ CAD 157.85 (≈ US $114)

Key policies
• All above include buffet breakfast.  
• Airport shuttle: free, runs every 30 min; first-come, first-served.  
• Parking on-site: CAD 15/day if needed.  
• Credit card & photo ID required at check-in; CAD 100 deposit (refundable).

Latest user reviews (sorted newest → oldest)

1. “Estancia cercana al aeropuerto con traslado incluido” – Zoad (MX), 22 Oct 2024, 7.2/10  
   + Breakfast was good & plentiful.  
   − Waited over an hour for the airport pick-up shuttle.

2. “Excellent customer service” – Wendy (CA), 21 Oct 2024, 8/10  
   + Shuttle efficient both ways, clean room, comfy bed, friendly staff.  
   − Stayed < 12 h; nothing negative.

3. “Para una breve estancia cerca al aeropuerto” – Andres (ES), 21 Oct 2024, 6.4/10  
   + Reliable shuttle, good for one night.  
   − Décor/facilities a bit dated.

4. Alessandro (FR/IT), 21 Oct 2024, 7.2/10  
   + Overall “fabulous” for a quick business stop-over (no details given).

5. “Convenient for a one-night stop-over” – Susan (GB), 21 Oct 2024, 6.4/10  
   + Very close to airport; pick-up efficient.  
   − Breakfast quality could be better.

Should you book?  
Quality Inn is the closest budget-friendly option available tonight, offers a 24-h free shuttle and free breakfast, and still has a handful of rooms left. If you’re certain of your plans, Room #1 is cheapest; if you’d like flexibility, choose Room #2 (free cancellation until 16:00). Either will get you to Pearson in minutes for tomorrow-morning’s flight.

I need to catch a flight that takes off from Seattle-Tacoma International Airport on December 5, 2024, tomorrow morning. I plan to stay at a hotel near the airport tonight. Recommend a hotel that's less than 20 kilometers from the airport, and check the details of the available rooms and the latest user reviews for this hotel.

messages.content:
Recommended stay for the night of 4 Dec 2024 (check-out 5 Dec 2024)

Property: The Mediterranean Inn – Seattle
• Distance from SEA (Seattle-Tacoma Intl.): ≈19 km (12 mi) / 20–25 min by car or rideshare  
• Address: 425 Queen Anne Ave N, Seattle, WA 98109  
• Rating: 8.6 / 10 (“Fabulous”, 3 860+ reviews)  
• Check-in from 16:00 | Check-out by 12:00  
• Free Wi-Fi, rooftop deck with skyline view, 24-h fitness room, free lobby coffee/tea, on-site parking (surcharge), many restaurants within a block.

Available rooms & tonight’s rates (4 → 5 Dec, 1 room / 1 adult)

1) Room Selected at Check-In  
   • 1 bed (queen or king, assigned on arrival), 26 m²  
   • Free cancellation until 23:59 on 2 Dec (property time)  
   • Pay nothing until 30 Nov – pay at/just before stay  
   • Price: US $137.31 + taxes/fees US $36.67 ≈ US $174 total

2) Queen Room  
   • 1 queen bed, kitchenette, 28 m²  
   • Same free-cancellation and pay-later rules as above  
   • Price: US $144.21 + taxes/fees US $38.52 ≈ US $183 total

3) King Room  
   • 1 king bed, 30 m²  
   • Same policies  
   • Price: US $151.11 + taxes/fees US $40.36 ≈ US $191 total

4) Double Room with Two Double Beds (sleeps up to 4)  
   • 2 double beds, kitchenette, 28 m²  
   • Same policies  
   • Price: US $151.11 + taxes/fees US $40.36 ≈ US $191 total

(All rates already reflect a 31 % “Late Escape Deal” discount. Parking ~US $20/night, payable at property.)

Most-recent guest feedback (sorted newest→oldest)

• 22 Oct 2024 – Sarah (US, couple) – King Room – 8/10  
  “Very good.” Liked room size & cleanliness, noted limited breakfast options (coffee/tea only).

• 22 Oct 2024 – Erika (MX, couple) – Mystery Room – 7/10  
  “Pleasant.” Positive staff interaction; commented that in-room A/C a little noisy at night.

• 22 Oct 2024 – Steve (AU, couple) – King Room – 8/10  
  “Very good.” Highlighted location for sightseeing; wished for cheaper parking.

• 22 Oct 2024 – Edson (BR, friends) – Double Double – 9/10  
  “Great location and service.” Appreciated front-desk friendliness & easy bus access.

• 21 Oct 2024 – Joni (US, family) – Double Double – 7/10  
  “Pleasant.” Liked kitchenette for snacks; felt mattresses could be firmer.

Why it works for your plan tomorrow
• Within your 20-km radius and still in downtown—easy 20-25 min Lyft/Uber ride to SEA in the morning.  
• Free cancellation and no pre-payment until 30 Nov give flexibility.  
• Multiple room types still available tonight; cheapest option (US $174 all-in) covers a comfortable bed, Wi-Fi and morning coffee before your early flight.

Tip: If you prefer to be even closer (SeaTac city hotels are 3–5 km from the terminals), inventory for tonight is very tight; this property is the closest with current availability and free-cancellation flexibility.

result.pros: Near water front. Clean
result.cons: Slightly unfriendly stuff. No towels in the room. Way to expensive for one night.
result.title: Way to expensive for one night, it was clean but realy worn. It’s ok if need a shelter for one night.
Nice place just outside of Boston, but overpriced for unfinished work.
result.pros: Lobby/bar/restaurant was gorgeous. Great location and off street parking.
result.cons: They are under construction and many things were unfinished. The shower head looked like it was decades old and didn’t function well.

result.title: Rustig hotel, matige kwaliteit
result.cons: Bed kraakte en de airco was erg luidruchtig.
result.pros: Rustig gelegen, vlak aan zee, dicht bij Boston. Snachts is het er rustig

result.title: Superbe petit hotel dans un quartier pittoresque de Boston
result.cons: Petit déj non disponible
result.pros: Superbe petit hotel avec vie sur mer dans le quartier de East Boston. Pas loin de l'aéroport mais pas trop bruyant.

messages.content:
Recommended hotel (within 30 km of BOS)

Winthrop Arms Hotel – Restaurant – Logan Airport  
• Address: 130 Grovers Ave, Winthrop, MA 02152  
• Straight-line distance to Logan Airport: ≈ 4–5 km (10–12 min by taxi/Lyft; traffic-free).  
• Google/Booking rating: 8.1 / 10 (“Very good”, 265 reviews).  
• Key features: free on-site parking, waterfront location, on-site restaurant/bar, free  Wi-Fi.  
• Check-in/Check-out: 16:00 – 23:00 / by 12:00.

Availability for tonight (Fri 29 Nov → Sat 30 Nov 2024)

All prices below are the current mobile rate pulled directly from Booking.com.  
Taxes (11.7 %) — ~US$24 — are NOT included in the “room price” column but are reflected in the “total”.

| Room (only 1 of each left) | Size / Beds | Cancellation & payment | Room price | Total (room + tax) |
|---|---|---|---|---|
| Queen Suite – Sea View | 28 m² • 1 Queen • upper floors • water view | Free cancellation until 23:59 on 14 Nov 2024. Pre-payment of full amount at any time; fully refundable if you cancel before the deadline. | US $207.90 | US $232.22 |
| Standard Suite | 19 m² • 1 Queen | Same policy as above | US $207.90 | US $232.22 |
| Queen Room – Sea View | 28 m² • 1 Queen | Same policy as above | US $207.90 | US $232.22 |

Notes  
• All rooms are sold on a “room-only” basis (no breakfast included).  
• Free on-site parking must be reserved when you book.  
• Property is undergoing some renovation; see recent reviews.

Snapshot of the five most recent reviews (newest → older)

1. 21 Oct 2024 – Michael (CH, solo, score 2/5)  
   + Clean, right on the waterfront.  
   – Staff felt unfriendly; towels missing; “too expensive for one night”.

2. 14 Oct 2024 – Prentiss (US, friends, score 4/5) “Exceptional”  
   (Short review; no specific negatives mentioned.)

3. 10 Oct 2024 – Abby (US, couple, score 2.4/5)  
   + Gorgeous lobby/bar; free off-street parking; good location.  
   – Hotel under construction; dated shower hardware.

4. 10 Oct 2024 – Ron (NL, couple, score 2.8/5)  
   + Quiet seaside neighbourhood, close to Boston.  
   – Squeaky bed, noisy A/C.

5. 7 Oct 2024 – Cedric (BE, couple, score 4/5)  
   + “Charming little hotel with sea view, not far from airport and not too noisy.”  
   – No breakfast offered.

Bottom-line

• Location is excellent for an early-morning flight from Logan (≈ 10 min ride).  
• Rooms are spacious for the price and fully refundable up to two weeks prior, but the building is older and currently undergoing upgrades — reflected in mixed recent comments about finish quality and value.  
• If you value proximity, seaside views, and on-site dining over brand-new fittings, this is a solid, convenient choice for tonight.

I need to catch a flight that takes off from Miami International Airport on December 15, 2024, tomorrow morning. I plan to stay at a hotel near the airport tonight. Recommend a hotel that's less than 40 kilometers from the airport, and check the details of the available rooms and the latest user reviews for this hotel.
