messages.content:
Here are the two least-expensive Chicago–area properties that (a) advertise an airport-shuttle facility and (b) were available for 25–30 Nov 2024 for 2 adults + 1 child (8 yrs).  Prices shown already include taxes/fees and reflect the exact search dates and party size you gave.

1)  Quality Inn O’Hare Airport  
   • Location Schiller Park, about 23 km (14 mi) from downtown Chicago – 5 min drive to ORD terminals  
   • Category 2-star hotel ‑ 6.7 / 10 “Pleasant” (≈680 reviews)  
   • Room/price found 2-bed room, 5 nights for US $379.82 total  
   • Airport shuttle Listed as “Airport shuttle” (usually runs on a timetable; small fee or free in many plans—confirm when booking)  
   • Child policy  
     – “Children of any age are welcome.”  
     – Guests aged 18+ are charged as adults.  
     – No cots or extra beds are available.  

2)  Super 8 by Wyndham Chicago Northlake O’Hare South  
   • Location Northlake, about 22 km (14 mi) from downtown; ≈10 min to ORD by shuttle  
   • Category 2-star motel ‑ 5.9 / 10 “Okay” (≈325 reviews)  
   • Room/price found 1-queen-bed room, 5 nights for US $427.28 total (free-cancellation Secret Deal)  
   • Airport shuttle Advertised “Airport shuttle” service (check whether a surcharge applies).  
   • Child policy  
     – “Children of any age are welcome.”  
     – Guests aged 18+ are considered adults.  
     – No cots or extra beds available.  

How to proceed / things to double-check  
• Shuttle details (schedule, pick-up point, cost) vary by property—verify with the hotel before finalizing.  
• Both hotels accept a single room for 2 adults + 1 eight-year-old as searched; if you prefer two beds at Super 8 or need guaranteed bedding, choose that option during booking.  
• Prices can fluctuate; lock the rate quickly if it suits you.  
• If you prefer a free shuttle specifically, some properties list “Airport shuttle (free)”—those started about US $434 for these dates.  

Let me know if you’d like links, alternatives nearer downtown, or help with airport transfers!

messages.content:
Here are the two lowest-priced Paris hotels that (a) still had rooms for 5–10 Nov 2024, (b) advertise an “Airport Shuttle” facility, and (c) allow you to book for 2 adults + 1 two-year-old child:

────────────────────────────────────────
1)  Hôtel Du Brabant   (2-star)
   • District: 10ᵗʰ arr. – 2.3 km from city centre, a short walk from Gare du Nord / Gare de l’Est.  
   • Total price: about US $611 (≈ €562) for 5 nights – taxes & charges included; free cancellation, no pre-payment required.  
   • Review score: 5.7 / 10 (“Okay”, 2 276 reviews).  
   • Airport shuttle: Offered on request (typically paid; confirm cost and schedule with the hotel).  
   • Child policy  
       – “Children of any age are welcome.”  
       – Cot & extra beds:  
         • 0–2 yrs → Baby-cot available on request, FREE (subject to availability).  
         • No extra beds possible.  
       – Any cot fees (if applicable) are paid separately at the property.  

────────────────────────────────────────
2)  Hotel Regina Montmartre   (3-star)
   • District: 18ᵗʰ arr. – at the foot of Montmartre/Sacré-Cœur, 3 km from centre.  
   • Total price: about US $664 (≈ €612) for 5 nights – taxes & charges included (standard free-cancellation option shown).  
   • Review score: 5.1 / 10 (“Passable”, 960 reviews).  
   • Airport shuttle: Offered on request (usually for an additional fee; confirm with hotel).  
   • Child policy  
       – “Children of any age are welcome.”  
       – Children aged 3 + are charged as adults, so your 2-year-old remains a child and stays free in existing bedding.  
       – No cots or extra beds are available.  

Tips before you book
• If you need a baby-cot, pick Hôtel Du Brabant and e-mail them straight after booking to secure one.  
• Paris “airport shuttles” are almost never free; ask for the exact price and whether it’s a private or shared transfer.  
• Prices can move daily and will finally be charged in EUR, so small currency differences are normal.  

Let me know if you’d like to see better-rated (but still inexpensive) hotels, properties with guaranteed free shuttles, or anything else!

messages.content:
Here are the two least-expensive Sydney properties (20–25 Nov 2024, 2 adults + 1 child aged 6) that advertise an Airport-Shuttle service.  Prices below are the total for five nights in the requested configuration and include the taxes & charges shown at search-time.

1) ibis Sydney Airport  
   • Star rating / guest score: 3½ ★  | 7.2 / 10 “Good” (≈5,900 reviews)  
   • Location: Mascot – about 1 km from SYD terminals, ~7 km to CBD  
   • Room shown in search: Standard room, two beds, free Wi-Fi, A/C  
   • Price: approx. US $649 (≈AU $1,000) for 20–25 Nov (5 nights, 1 room, 2 adults + 1 child)  
   • Airport shuttle: Yes (private shuttle—fee applies, book with hotel)  

   Child policy (key points)  
   • “Children of any age are welcome.”  
   • Children 12 yrs + are charged as adults.  
   • Cot 0-2 yrs: free (on request, subject to availability).  
   • Extra bed 3 yrs +: about US $26.56 per person per night (on request).    
   • Add the child’s age during booking so the price shown is correct.

2) ibis budget Sydney Airport  
   • Star rating / guest score: 3 ★ | 6.9 / 10 “Pleasant” (≈15,600 reviews)  
   • Location: Mascot – about 600 m from domestic terminal, ~7 km to CBD  
   • Room shown in search: Standard room, two beds, free Wi-Fi, A/C  
   • Price: approx. US $664 (≈AU $1,025) for 5 nights, same occupancy  
   • Airport shuttle: Yes (external shuttle service—fee applies, runs every 30 min)  

   Child policy (key points)  
   • “Children of any age are welcome.”  
   • Children 5 yrs + are charged as adults.  
   • Cot 0-2 yrs: about US $13.28 per child per night (on request).  
   • The property states “There is no capacity for extra beds.”  
   • Because your child is 6 yrs, they count as an adult in this hotel’s pricing.

What this means for your family  
• The quoted totals already include your 6-year-old because the search was done with that age specified; however ibis budget may still price them as an adult, so the room you book will likely need to accommodate three “adults”.  
• If you prefer a roll-away/extra bed rather than sharing existing beds, ibis Sydney Airport can provide one at ~US $26.56 per night; ibis budget cannot.  
• Both hotels provide paid shuttle transfers; typical cost is AU $10–15 per person each way—confirm and book directly with the hotel after reserving.

Next steps  
1. When you book, ensure the occupancy field shows 3 guests (2 adults, 1 child 6 yrs).  
2. If you need the extra bed at ibis Sydney Airport, request it in the “special requests” box or call/email the hotel.  
3. Check cancellation and pre-payment rules on the final booking page—these vary by room rate.

Feel free to let me know if you’d like alternative options (e.g., closer to the CBD, with breakfast, higher review scores, etc.).

messages.content:
Cheapest Vienna hotels (25 – 30 Dec 2024) that advertise an airport-shuttle and were the two lowest-priced results returned for your family (2 adults + 1 child aged 3).

1. Lenas Donau Hotel  
   • Category / rating: 3-star, Review score 7.4 (“Good”) – about 9 000+ reviews  
   • Area: 22. Donaustadt – ca. 5 km from the historic centre, on the Danube waterfront, direct U-bahn (Kagran) into town  
   • Price for 5 nights, 1 room: ≈ US $501 (about €459) incl. taxes/fees  
   • Airport shuttle: Yes (paid, book through reception; runs to/from VIE)  
   • Child policy (key points for a 3-year-old)  
     – “Children of any age are welcome.”  
     – Children aged 6 + are charged as adults.  
     – 0-3 yrs: • Cot on request €10.0 ≈ US$10.8 per night • Extra bed on request €16 – 17 ≈ US$17.3 per night  
     – Cots/extra beds subject to availability; the hotel asks you to state the child’s age when booking.

2. Hotel König  
   • Category / rating: 3-star, Review score 8.0 (“Very good”) – 1 500+ reviews  
   • Area: 11. Simmering – about 6 km south-east of the centre, 15 min by S-bahn/underground to Stephansplatz  
   • Price for 5 nights, 1 room: ≈ US $604 (about €553) incl. taxes/fees  
   • Airport shuttle: Yes (paid; arrange with hotel)  
   • Child policy (for a 3-year-old)  
     – “Children of any age are welcome.”  
     – Children aged 6 + are charged as adults.  
     – 0-2 yrs: cot on request – FREE  
     – 0-2 yrs & 3 + yrs: extra bed on request €26 – 27 ≈ US$28.2 per night  
     – No complimentary cots once the child turns 3; an extra bed is needed and charged. Availability must be confirmed with the property.

How to book smartly
• Enter “1 room, 2 adults, 1 child (age 3)” when booking so prices/availability reflect the child.  
• Both shuttles are chargeable and normally need to be reserved in advance; ask for cost when you confirm.  
• Prices shown are the live “cheapest mobile rate” returned by Booking’s API on today’s query; they can fluctuate.  
• If you need a cot/extra bed, mention it in the “Special Requests” box or message the hotel immediately after booking.

These two hotels are currently the least-expensive options that satisfy your airport-shuttle filter for the requested dates.
